description: Aromas of vanilla bean, star anise and cinnamon are sprinkled atop black cherry and sweet woodsmoke on the lush nose of this bottling. The palate is broad and rich yet edged by a graphite minerality, offering flavors of black cherry and mocha.
title: Hahn 2016 SLH Gabrielle Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: From a small vineyard owned by the Vieira family for several generations, this wine is dense, impressive and packed with rich black fruits. Its tannins and smoky, tarry character are now almost mature, and the result is very fine. This major wine will be ready to drink from 2020.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2014 Vale da Mata Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: From old vines at the producer's Quinta S. Luiz in the Douro, the wine is dense as much as it is rich. The smooth tannins and powerful dark structure give the wine weight. That is balanced by the black fruits, freshened by acidity. The wine is now perfectly ready to drink.
title: Kopke 2014 Vinhas Velhas Limited Edition Red (Douro)

description: The wine comes from a pre-phylloxera plantation in a field blend. It is imposing, packed with tannins still and with great black fruits and a dense, complex structure. The wine's power comes from its firmness even though it is not overpowering. It just needs plenty of time, and should not be drunk before 2023.
title: Quinta das Carvalhas 2016 Carvalhas Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)

description: A beautiful shade of crimson-laced purple in the glass, this fresh bottling is loaded with aromas of wet slate, crushed granite, wet concrete, lavender, wisteria blossom and black plum on the nose. The bright and snappy palate shows rose, black raspberry and plum skin.
title: Samuel Louis Smith 2017 Sandstone Terrace Syrah (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Tones of wet chalk, lime blossom and citrus pith make for an aromatic entry to this bottling. The palate shows orange skin, light oak and an intensely chalky minerality, clinging to the mouth with tang and structure. It is texturally complex but it goes down easy as well.
title: Samuel Louis Smith 2017 Spear Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Showing elegance and surprising structure for the cool, wet vintage, this delivers Marasca cherry, raspberry, licorice, tobacco and white-pepper flavors set against youthfully taut fine-grained tannins. Bright acidity lends balance and tension. Drink 2022–2029.
title: San Polino 2014 Helicrysum  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: Woodland-berry, forest-floor, new leather and exotic spice aromas take center stage. The firmly structured, elegant palate delivers ripe Morello cherry, star anise, blood orange and tobacco set against close-grained tannins and firm acidity that lead to a rather drying finish.
title: Siro Pacenti 2014 Vecchie Vigne  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: This is such an impressive appellation-wide blend, combining several vineyard sites into a cohesive whole. Incredibly aromatic in rose and raspberry, the palate brings velvety layers of dark cherry and cinnamon, with integrated acidity keeping the balance.
title: Williams Selyem 2017 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Ripe, smooth blackberry and tobacco aromas are chocolaty and subtle. Full allotments of black fruits, tannins and acidity play well together, while this tastes of blackberry, black cherry and baking spice. To back it all up, a rock-solid finish with notes of lemony oak, vanilla and tobacco is on point. Drink through 2028.
title: 12 Linajes 2014 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

description: This is a light, bright and fresh red wine, made well and restrained in its use of oak. Candied plum and cherry flavors meld effortlessly with earthy forest characteristics and a lovely jolt of Asian spice. The finish introduces a balance of black tea.
title: Ancien 2016 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: This Bordeaux blend is Merlot dominant (40%) with 33% Malbec and 27% Cabernet Sauvignon, which results in a wine with lifted fruit and elegance amid power and density. The nose leads with aromas of black cherry, chocolate, cracked pepper and pencil lead. The palate is full bodied, balanced by juicy fruit and a firmly structured line of savory tannins. The oak influence shows but is well integrated, supporting rather than overpowering. A long herbal finish caps things off. A classy wine that should age beautifully until 2029 and likely beyond.
title: Babich 2016 The Patriarch Gimblett Gravels Red (Hawke's Bay)

description: Clean aromas of ripe red fruits, carnations and wet rocks make for an attention-grabbing entry to this blend of 50% Grenache, 27% Cabernet Sauvignon and 23% Tempranillo. The palate opens very tightly with grippy hints of lanolin and wood before smashed boysenberry flavors lead into a vanilla-kissed finish. Drink 2021–2026.
title: Benom 2016 Les Deux Freres Red (Paso Robles)

description: This comes from selected parcels that are not seen as part of the main Angélus vineyards. The wine is rich and stylish, with layers of black fruits and generous tannins. Freshness in the midst of all this richness gives a bright character. Drink the wine from 2023.
title: Château Angélus 2016 Carillon d'Angélus  (Saint-Émilion)

description: This bijou property with its new stylish winery is owned by the Fabre family. Situated at the north of Margaux, the vineyard has produced a firm, spicy and densely structured wine with bold tannins and great richness. Drink sfrom 2023.
title: Château Bellevue de Tayac 2016  Margaux

description: One of the many estates on the Pez plateau in Saint-Estèphe, this property is at the top of its game. Owned by the same proprietors as Pichon Longueville Comtesse de Lalande, the wine has structure, big tannins as well as dense black fruits. Drink from 2024.
title: Château de Pez 2016  Saint-Estèphe

description: Coming from this vastly improved estate, this wine offers rich tannins, concentration, power and density. Blackberry flavors add a more immediately approachable side to this wine that should be ready to drink from 2024.
title: Château Grand-Puy Ducasse 2016  Pauillac

description: This is a rich wine with bold tannins from a small property purchased in 2014 by the Vauthier family of Château Ausone. With its structure and density, the tannins show richly and the wine will develop with balance and style. Drink from 2023.
title: Château la Clotte 2016  Saint-Émilion

description: This wine has intensity as well as rich fruitiness. It comes from a small unclassified property in Margaux, sharing many of the elegant, perfumed characteristics of better-known estates. Black-currant flavors abound, along with ripe tannins. Drink from 2023.
title: Château la Galiane 2016  Margaux

description: This perfumed wine is rich in black fruits bursting with juicy berry flavors and acidity. A dry core promises both good aging potential and great fruitiness. The silky structure is developing well and the wine should be ready to drink from 2024.
title: Château Larcis Ducasse 2016  Saint-Émilion
